show.title: Barb & Star Go to Vista del Mar
show.headline: The friendship we all want. The vacation we all need.

landscapeHeroImage.altText: BARB AND STAR GO TO VISTA DEL MAR

posterImages.altText: BARB AND STAR GO TO VISTA DEL MAR

event.title: <show-title>Barb & Star Go to Vista del Mar</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Head to Palm Vista for an interactive screening with props & official couples
event.description:
Cancel this month’s Talking Club, because the seagulls in the sand have heard our prayers and our BARB & STAR GO TO VISTA DEL MAR movie party is back!

Co-written and co-starring Kristen Wiig and Annie Mumulo, it’s the instant cult comedy classic tale of two Soft Rock, Nebraska, natives on an epic, soul-douching adventure in a little Florida oasis called Vista Del Mar. When these two frisky mid-lifers arrive, they find that Vista Del Mar has more than just a 24-hour CVS and Tommy Bahama-clad hunks, it’s filled with lethal mosquitos, human cannons, water spirits, banana boats, and one very reluctantly crowned Shrimp Queen.

At the BARB & STAR Movie Party, there’ll be dancing, there’ll be singing, and there’ll be a whole lot of being who you are. We’ll also have special Vista Del Mar visors, leis, and other party favors there waiting for you.

So get excited! Whip out your seashell phone, call Trish (who trusts), and pick out your favorite pair of parachute culottes for our interactive celebration of our favorite besties of 2021, Barb and Star.

posterImage.altText: Barb Star MP Web SHOW P 960x1400

event.title: <show-title>Legally Blonde</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: A party for the Gemini vegetarian in all of us
event.description: Start practicing your bend and snap, because we’re putting on an interactive screening of the bubbliest of films with the bubbliest of drinks – the LEGALLY BLONDE Champagne Cinema Movie Party! Go blonde and join us for a celebration of the 2001 comedy starring Reese Witherspoon with fun props, champagne available for order, and plenty of Luke Wilson looking dreamy. When you arrive, we'll provide you with nail stickers that any Gemini vegetarian would be honored to wear, a manicure kit to keep everything up to Harvard standards, and a fuzzy pen, because what else are you going to take notes with in class?!

event.title: <show-title>Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse</show-title> <event-type-title>Family Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Swing into action at our fun, interactive, & Spider-family-friendly screening
event.description: Get your web slingers ready, we’re diving into the Spider-Verse for our SPIDER-MAN: ACROSS THE SPIDER-VERSE Family Party! Never been to a Family Party? You’re in for a Spider-Tastic time. Every Family Party features games, crafts, and fun props for you and your kids to enjoy before and after the movie. Bring your whole Spider-Team (no actual spiders though please) for interactive games, crafting your own felt mask like a proper Spider-Person, and themed props like yo-yos and mini sticky hands. It’s the best way in the universe (any universe) to see this Spider-Powered sequel. Your ticket includes the movie, the activities, and the props. Costumes are definitely encouraged – you wouldn’t want anyone finding out your secret identity now would you? Be sure to arrive up to 30 minutes early to give yourself plenty of time to get in on the fun.

show.title: Subspecies V: Blood Rise
show.headline: The theatrical premiere of Full Moon Features' latest

event.title: <show-title>Subspecies V: Blood Rise</show-title>
event.headline: The theatrical premiere of Full Moon Features' latest
event.description:
The special Graveyard Shift presentation includes an exclusive introduction and pre-recorded post-screening Q&A with members of the cast and director, Ted Nicolaou.

SUBSPECIES V: BLOODRISE follows the descent of Radu (once more played by series regular Anders Hove) from a noble warrior of the church to a depraved, blood-hungry creature of the night. Stolen by crusaders on the night of his birth from his demon mother and vampire father, Radu grows up with no knowledge of his monstrous bloodline. Trained and exploited by a brotherhood of mystic monks to slay all enemies of the church, fate brings him back one night to his father's castle, armed with the monster-slaying Sword of Laertes, to destroy the vampire Vladislas and reclaim a holy relic, the Bloodstone.

Filmed in Serbia in and around historical castles and ruins, and co-starring original series star Denice Duff in a surprising role, this sensual, violent, and operatic exploration of evil marks a stunning return for one of the screen's most beloved monsters.

SUBSPECIES V: BLOODRISE is directed by series mainstay Ted Nicolaou (TERRORVISION), making SUBSPECIES one of the only horror franchises in which every entry is helmed by the same director.

show.title: Tetsuo: The Iron Man
show.headline: Shinya Tsukamoto’s unhinged body horror manifesto.

event.title: <show-title>Tetsuo: The Iron Man</show-title>
event.headline: Shinya Tsukamoto’s unhinged tech-body horror mind-warper
event.description:
Welcome to filmmaker Shinya Tsukamoto’s unhinged hot take on humankind’s ongoing battle with technology; literally, as a man mutates into a walking man-machine that terrorizes himself and everyone around him. Warping elements of early Cronenberg, Lynch, and Raimi into a cyberpunk cocktail, TETSUO is a body horror manifesto that’s fueled by techno-erotic adrenaline and wrought iron perversion. Virtually absent from theater screens since the 1990s, this underground classic from Japan has been newly restored.

Restoration courtesy of Arrow Films and the American Genre Film Archive.

show.title: Stunt Rock
show.headline: The explosive Ozploitation classic, newly restored in 4k

event.title: <show-title>Stunt Rock</show-title>
event.headline: The explosive Ozploitation classic, newly restored in 4k
event.description: STUNT ROCK is an all caps love letter to the dangerous deeds mortal men and women commit in the name of entertainment. When just diving off a cliff isn't enough, Australian stuntman extraordinaire Grant Page does it backwards...on fire. When putting on a rock concert isn't enough, bizarro hard rockers Sorcery add a magic show...and fire. In a less perfect world these things would've happened undocumented, but the action-junkie director with an eye for gorgeous photography Brian Trenchard-Smith (BMX BANDITS, MAN FROM HONG KONG) committed it all to celluloid in the quasi-documentary, quasi-concert film, total-blast STUNT ROCK. The wispy plot is just window dressing for the money shots: death-defying leaps, car chases, and a magician in a Merlin get-up shooting fireballs while a bunch of dudes with long hair pound out muscular rock music. Bring your own safety-harness, there are no nets where we're going.

event.description: Be among the first to experience the epic live-action reimagining, as we invite you to an early screening of Disney’s THE LITTLE MERMAID. posterImage.altText: THE LITTLE MERMAID Early Access Screening sp poster

contentBlocks.paragraphs: Be among the first to experience the epic live-action reimagining, as we invite you to an early screening of Disney’s THE LITTLE MERMAID. Join Ariel and all of her friends under the sea on an adventure to discover new worlds and treasures unknown. All guests will receive a commemorative poster to add to their collection!

imageAsset.title: The Little Mermaid Sketchbook Web Deluxe Showpage 1920x1080
imageAsset.caption: Limited Edition Sketchbook

contentBlocks.paragraphs: And no THE LITTLE MERMAID ticket is complete without our Limited Edition Sketchbook, a relic pulled from under the sea featuring custom artwork from artist Tom Whalen and a bonus sticker sheet. Perfect for drawing or journaling, this exclusive collectible is only available to order when you reserve your tickets early, so plan ahead if you want to get your fins on one. Add one to your ticket order between 4/26 - 5/04 by 11:59 pm CT, while supplies last, before they head under the sea forever.

event.title: <show-title>The Little Mermaid (2023)</show-title> <event-type-title>Family Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Enjoy under the sea fun at this musical, interactive screening
event.description: King Triton is making a rare exception to his “no mingling with land dwellers policy” to bring the seven seas to our theater for THE LITTLE MERMAID Family Party! Never been to a Family Party? You’re in for a treat. Every Family Party features games, crafts, and fun props for you and your kids to enjoy before and after the movie. Your family will enjoy fish headbands, inflatable saxophones, and can even craft their own seashell necklace or bracelet. Sing and dance along to old favorites and new bops – it’s the best way to experience this stunning reimagining of the original with a new generation. Your ticket includes the movie, the activities, and the props. Be sure to arrive up to 30 minutes early to give yourself plenty of time to get in on the fun.

show.title: A Nightmare on Elm Street 4: The Dream Master
show.headline: Freddy returns! And he brought pizza!

landscapeHeroImage.altText: A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET 4: THE DREAM MASTER

portraitHeroImage.altText: A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET 4: THE DREAM MASTER

posterImages.altText: A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET 4: THE DREAM MASTER

event.title: <show-title>A Nightmare on Elm Street 4: The Dream Master</show-title>
event.headline: Freddy returns in 35mm! And he brought pizza!
event.description: Where does the world’s most popular horror franchise go after A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET 3: THE DREAM WARRIORS (aka the greatest sequel of all time)? Easy! It’s called A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET 4: THE DREAM MASTER! This stylish head trip captures Freddy Krueger's transformation from a terrifying child murderer to a cuddly stand-up comic. Some people have a problem with that, but we don't. Because this is an outrageous fun bomb that explodes with stunning practical effects, a pizza with Freddy’s face on it, and a demonic dog named Jason who urinates a stream of fire. We should all cherish the fact that there was a time in history when THE DREAM MASTER could become the number-one movie in America. (Joseph A. Ziemba)

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Cloverfield
show.headline: The found footage annihilator in 35mm.

event.title: <show-title>Cloverfield</show-title>
event.headline: The found footage annihilator in 35mm
event.description:
Arriving at the exact moment before social media annihilated everyone's brains, CLOVERFIELD is the viral sensation from mega-producer J.J. Abrams and director Matt Reeves (THE BATMAN) that reinvigorated found footage horror...again. The story follows a group of partying twenty-somethings (most notably Lizzy Caplan from PARTY DOWN) as they navigate the attacks of a giant beast in New York City. One of the great kaiju – or kaiju-adjacent, should you follow the right subreddit – films of the 21st century, CLOVERFIELD is back on the big screen the way it was meant to be seen: in a gorgeous 35mm print that was blown up from digital video.

Screening an archival 35mm print

show.title: Hellraiser III: Hell on Earth
show.headline: What started in Hell will end on Earth

event.title: <show-title>Hellraiser III: Hell on Earth</show-title>
event.headline: Pinhead's revenge party
event.description:
We have such sights to show you...again. Executive produced by series creator Clive Barker and directed by Anthony Hickox (WAXWORK), HELLRAISER III: HELL ON EARTH is a supremely ‘90s explosion of gothic horror opulence. This sequel retains everything we love about the HELLRAISER franchise (surrealist visuals, cosmic kinks, buckets of gloop) while leaning far more into what we’ve always wanted: unhinged carnage from Pinhead and his cenobite friends. This includes many deaths via compact disc. If there was ever a movie that earned its Motörhead theme song, it’s this one.

Screening the 4K restoration

eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Poltergeist (1982)
show.headline: PG-rated horror has never been so scary.

event.title: <show-title>Poltergeist (1982)</show-title>
event.headline: Director Tobe Hooper and producer Steven Spielberg know what scares you
event.description:
"They're here!"

Forty years ago, Steven Spielberg harvested some of his unused ideas from a pre-E.T. alien invasion film about an ordinary family pitted against the unknown, added in some supernatural elements from his darkest fears, and hired Tobe Hooper to direct. The result is the all-time American horror classic, POLTERGEIST - screening via a gorgeous new 4K restoration courtesy of Warner Brothers.

JoBeth Williams and Craig T. Nelson star as the Freelings, whose average suburban family is tested when unexplained phenomena begin to manifest in their house. What begins as curiosity turns to terror when their young daughter (played wonderfully by Heather O'Rourke) goes missing. Together, the family must rally their strength to rescue the child from the demonic entity preying upon their home.

Don't miss a 40th anniversary screening of one of the greatest ghost movies ever made. There's a reason this movie is a classic, folks.

eventType.title: Special Event
eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers
eventType.description: Whether it’s a movie-inspired feast, an interactive party, or a screening paired with a live performance, we love sharing the movies we love in new and exciting ways.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Silent Hill
show.headline: The haunting video game adaptation.

event.title: <show-title>Silent Hill</show-title>
event.headline: The haunting video game adaptation.
event.description:
An ambitious live-action adaptation of the video game series, SILENT HILL finds Rosa (Radha Mitchell) and her missing daughter navigating a mysterious alternate dimension that’s filled with jaw-dropping monsters, bizarre puzzles, and vengeful witches. Unlike most American horror movies from the 2000s, SILENT HILL isn’t concerned with nu metal riffage or SAW-styled torture scenes. Instead, the movie combines the folk-tinged creeps of Japanese horror films with an elegant approach to design. The result is a haunting, psychedelic experience that feels like being trapped in a waking nightmare.

Screening an archival 35mm print.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Silver Bullet
show.headline: When darkness falls, terror rises

event.title: <show-title>Silver Bullet</show-title>
event.headline: Don't miss this werewolf classic, screening along with a graphic novel signing
event.description:
WHERE WOLF – a new creator-owned graphic novel from creative team Rob Saucedo, Debora Lancianese, and Jack Morelli – is set in the wild world of furry conventions, small-town Texas journalism, and werewolf whodunit.

Leading up to the wide release of the book, writer and Graveyard Shift programmer Rob Saucedo will tour movie theaters across the country, screening werewolf films and providing an opportunity to purchase the graphic novel early at concurrent signing events.

In WHERE WOLF, something scary stalks the streets of Texas, leaving a trail of corpses in its wake. The only person standing in its way is Larry Chaney, a slacker reporter who can’t hold a job, can’t keep a girlfriend, and can’t stop getting in the way of his own career. Larry must go undercover at a local furry convention if he has any hope of stopping the beast dead set on turning the gathered attendees into an all-you-can-eat buffet. The graphic novel is a love letter to werewolf fans, with an irreverent bent that takes decades of lycanthropic lore to new heights and surprising places.

The only person standing in its way is Larry Chaney, a slacker reporter who can’t hold a job, can’t keep a girlfriend, and can’t stop getting in the way of his own career. Larry must go undercover at a local furry convention if he has any hope of stopping the beast dead set on turning the gathered attendees into an all-you-can-eat buffet. The graphic novel is a love letter to werewolf fans, with an irreverent bent that takes decades of lycanthropic lore to new heights and surprising places.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Spawn
show.headline: Born in darkness. Sworn to justice.

event.title: <show-title>Spawn</show-title>
event.headline: Born in darkness. Sworn to justice.
event.description: Al Simmons (Michael Jai White) is an elite commando who is murdered by corrupt government agent Jason Wynn (Martin Sheen). But Satan has other plans – namely, he transforms Simmons into the zombie hell-revenger known as Spawn! Based on Todd McFarlane’s groundbreaking comic book, SPAWN is an inspired action-horror spectacle that’s unlike anything you’ve ever seen. Notable for featuring White as the first major African-American comic book superhero on the big screen, SPAWN is also a synapse-blasting explosion of H.P. Lovecraft-inspired monstrosities and a Gothic atmosphere that would make Clive Barker proud. (This includes John Leguizamo’s performance as a nightmarish, toxic filth-spewing clown named...Clown.)

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The People Under the Stairs
show.headline: Wes Craven’s unsung classic

portraitHeroImage.altText: People under the stairs sp portrait

posterImages.altText: Showpage Poster People Under The Stairs

event.title: <show-title>The People Under the Stairs</show-title>
event.headline: Wes Craven's unsung classic
event.description: With LAST HOUSE ON THE LEFT, A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET, and SCREAM, the late Wes Craven revolutionized the horror genre on three separate occasions over three separate decades. But with THE PEOPLE UNDER THE STAIRS, Craven unleashed the most forward-thinking work of his career – a horror movie about the horrors of classism. Featuring incredible performances from Wendy Robie and Everett McGill (aka Ed and Nadine from Twin Peaks) and Ving Rhames (PULP FICTION), this nerve-shredding masterwork explodes with vicious violence, sick humor, and a heroic scene of a kid punching a rich scumbag in the crotch.

eventType.title: Special Event
eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers
eventType.description: Whether it’s a movie-inspired feast, an interactive party, or a screening paired with a live performance, we love sharing the movies we love in new and exciting ways.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Texas Chain Saw Massacre (1974)
show.headline: Get revved up for a 4K restoration of the nerve-shredding horror classic

event.title: <show-title>The Texas Chain Saw Massacre (1974)</show-title>
event.headline: Tobe Hooper’s ferocious classic
event.description:
Nothing will ever diminish the power of this movie. Shot through a cinéma vérité lens, THE TEXAS CHAIN SAW MASSACRE follows five friends that fall victim to the grotesque Leatherface and his cannibalistic family. With a beautifully raw DIY aesthetic and powerful performances, this shockingly realistic film revolutionized the horror landscape when it was unleashed on a politically and socially tumultuous America in 1974. Facing controversy and censorship throughout its troubled release, TEXAS CHAIN SAW has stood the test of time to become a landmark film and cultural milestone.

Screening the 4K restoration

show.title: The Innocent
show.headline: A man gets roped into the schemes of his new ex-convict stepfather

show.title: Action Jackson
show.headline: It's time for "Action!"

event.title: <show-title>Action Jackson</show-title>
event.headline: Lights, camera, ACTION JACKSON!
event.description: Carl Weathers is "JACKSON!" in ACTION JACKSON, an outlandish, one-liner-filled late '80s piece of genre cinema that more than lives up to its title. Directed by I COME IN PEACE and STONE COLD director Craig R. Baxley, who piles on the practical stunts and pyrotechnics, and filled to the brim with character actors galore, ACTION JACKSON is an underrated '80s action gem that belongs in the canon alongside LETHAL WEAPON, PREDATOR, and BEVERLY HILLS COP.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Bloodsport
show.headline: Witness the awesome might of the Muscles from Brussels!

event.title: <show-title>Bloodsport</show-title>
event.headline: Witness the awesome might of the Muscles from Brussels!
event.description:
Prepare to have tufts of hair spontaneously explode all over your body and your goosebumps ripple into the manliest muscles you've ever seen as you witness the Muscles from Brussels roundhouse kick his way into your heart.

Jean-Claude Van Damme stars as real-life martial artist and frequent split-doer Frank Dux in the debatably true story of his time deserting the military to pursue his dreams of competing in the underground martial arts tournament, the Kumite, where pulses pound, bones shatter, and roundhouses are delivered in stylish slow-motion.

Van Damme dazzles as he fights his way to the top to square off against the epically brutal Kumite champ Chong Li (Bolo Yeung). Nothing can prepare you for the epic tale of Van Damme's first starring role that catapulted him to international stardom. Van Damme doesn't waste a single second of his screentime as a marvel of movement who kicks, punches, splits, and smashes bricks with his bare hands as he delivers 90 pulse-pounding white-knuckle minutes of pure VAN DAMMAGE!

eventType.title: Special Event
eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: D.E.B.S.
show.headline: The lovingly queer spy adventure of your dreams

event.title: <show-title>D.E.B.S.</show-title>
event.headline: The lovingly queer spy adventure of your dreams
event.description:
The year is 2004. Your dad is a Republican. The razorblades that are your emaciated hipbones saw through your super low rise jeans with every step. You own a lot of stuff that is colored powder blue and silver, like, just A LOT.

In comes D.E.B.S. D.E.B.S. is the spiritual spawn of the extreme femme-ness of the first season of The L Word and a Disney Channel Original Movie.

In a universe where everyone is actually really, really nice — including international crime lords and nationalist super spies – you get to see Jordana Brewster from The Fast & Furious series match wits with a woman who looks just like every popular girl I went to high school with.

This movie is Buffy-sploitation at its finest. We love to see roundhouse kicks in heels, we love for Powerpuff Girls to go gay, and we love to see Holland Taylor be the dean of a school of super hot young super spies.

So harken back to the days when people were commonly named things like “Scoot” and “Scud.” Put on a non-functional scarf as an accessory. Get ready to be a little fast and curious. I think you’ll really like D.E.B.S. (Natalie St. Clair)

35mm print courtesy of Sony Pictures Repertory.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Freeway
show.headline: Reese Witherspoon is no little red riding hood

event.title: <show-title>Freeway</show-title>
event.headline: Reese Witherspoon is no little red riding hood
event.description:
"Rude in the way the truth is rude – only funnier. The movie seduces with its humor, all the while presenting a realized vision of a harsh, absurd world." – Mick LaSalle, San Francisco Chronicle

Reese Witherspoon as potty-mouthed white trash Vanessa Lutz is among her most underrated roles. In this modern take on Little Red Riding Hood, Kiefer Sutherland plays the not-subtly named Bob Wolverton, a serial killer who meets his match in Vanessa, a 15-year-old on her way to her grandmother’s after her parents are both arrested. Bob picks her up hitchhiking, gains her trust, and then reveals himself – but Vanessa is sharp and quick, shooting him and leaving him for dead. Trouble is, he doesn’t die, and instead, she finds herself on trial. Can this bad-behaving juvenile delinquent win against a well-respected school counselor? You better believe she won’t go down without a fight! Written and directed by Matthew Bright (best known as the screenwriter for FORBIDDEN ZONE), FREEWAY is impressive and often hilarious with a great supporting cast including Brooke Shields, Amanda Plummer, and Dan Hedaya. (Cristina Cacciopo)

contentBlocks.paragraphs:
WHERE WOLF - a new creator-owned graphic novel from creative team Rob Saucedo, Debora Lancianese and Jack Morelli - is set in the wild world of furry conventions, small-town Texas journalism and werewolf whodunit.

Leading up to the wide release of the book, writer and Alamo Drafthouse programmer Rob Saucedo will tour movie theaters across the country - screening werewolf and werewolf-adjacent films and providing an opportunity to purchase the graphic novel early at concurrent signing events.

"Rude in the way the truth is rude – only funnier. The movie seduces with its humor, all the while presenting a realized vision of a harsh, absurd world." – Mick LaSalle, San Francisco Chronicle

Reese Witherspoon as potty-mouthed white trash Vanessa Lutz is among her most underrated roles. In this modern take on Little Red Riding Hood, Kiefer Sutherland plays the not-subtly named Bob Wolverton, a serial killer who meets his match in Vanessa, a 15-year-old on her way to her grandmother’s after her parents are both arrested. Bob picks her up hitchhiking, gains her trust, and then reveals himself – but Vanessa is sharp and quick, shooting him and leaving him for dead. Trouble is, he doesn’t die, and instead, she finds herself on trial. Can this bad-behaving juvenile delinquent win against a well-respected school counselor? You better believe she won’t go down without a fight! Written and directed by Matthew Bright (best known as the screenwriter for FORBIDDEN ZONE), FREEWAY is impressive and often hilarious with a great supporting cast including Brooke Shields, Amanda Plummer, and Dan Hedaya. (Cristina Cacciopo)

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Mars Attacks!
show.headline: Tim Burton's star-studded alien invasion comedy

event.title: <show-title>Mars Attacks!</show-title>
event.headline: Chaos reigns in Tim Burton’s retro-kitsch disaster jam, in 35mm
event.description:
How do you follow the success of gargantuan blockbusters like BATMAN and BATMAN RETURNS? Well, if you’re oddball director Tim Burton, you decide to make a campy, violent, big-budget alien invasion comedy based on a series of sci-fi trading cards from the 1960s.

With an absurdly star-studded cast, including Pierce Brosnan, Glenn Close, Annette Bening, Danny DeVito, Michael J. Fox, Martin Short, Natalie Portman, Jack Black, Sarah Jessica Parker's head on a chihuahua’s body, and Jack Nicholson in two different roles, MARS ATTACKS! is a demented piece of retro-pop madness that represents Tim Burton at his very best. If you've never seen this epic, raucously funny cult classic, don't miss your chance to experience it on the big screen.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Perdita Durango (Dance with the Devil)
show.headline: Two frantic, ferocious, and free criminals on a dark road to cheap thrills

event.title: <show-title>Perdita Durango (Dance with the Devil)</show-title>
event.headline: A dark road to cheap thrills, from the writer of WILD AT HEART
event.description:
NYC: Hosted by Heather Buckley (Black Mansion Films)

Unpredictable and quite special, this off-the-chain semi-sequel to WILD AT HEART stars Rosie Perez, Javier Bardem, and James Gandolfini in the wildest movie of any of their respective careers. Directed by Spanish provocateur Alex de la Iglesia (DAY OF THE BEAST, ACCION MUTANTE), PERDITA’s nightmare splatter universe lingers in your imagination in an equal but different way than Lynch’s signature style.

Here, Perez reimagines Isabella Rossellini’s melancholic character into a tightly-coiled woman on the edge – one in love with an even crazier Bardem, who’s casually into blood rituals, bank/graverobbing, extortion, and wholesale slaughter. Gandolfini is just awesome as the bumbling FBI agent on their trail. This thing rocks.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Pink Flamingos
show.headline: Still filthy, 50 years later

event.title: <show-title>Pink Flamingos</show-title>
event.headline: Bad taste at its best
event.description:
Filth. Typically this is something we want to hide, eliminate, or ignore. John Waters wanted to celebrate it. After successfully completing two features, MONDO TRASHO and MULTIPLE MANIACS, Waters had honed his skills as a filmmaker and people began to take notice. Taking inspiration from exploitation legends such as William Castle, Russ Meyer, and Herschell Gordon Lewis as equally as from more respected figures such as Tennessee Williams and Douglas Sirk, Waters and his band of outsiders and weirdo creatives known as Dreamland took to the streets of his hometown of Baltimore and made movie history.

PINK FLAMINGOS follows megalomaniacal matriarch Babs Johnson (Divine) and her twisted family of miscreants as they vie for the title of "the filthiest people alive" with the Marbles (David Lochary and Mink Stole). Among the atrocities committed are skirt steaks shoplifted up skirts, public indecency, forced impregnation, and a final act so atrocious it lives on in the memory of anyone who has ever seen this film. Plot descriptions fail the experience of watching PINK FLAMINGOS, however. It's a colorful, raunchy, tasteless tour of tacky interiors, gaudy fashion, and the private lives of people so outrageously bad that you can't help but love them. It goes so far beyond the limits of what is typically acceptable to view in public with a group of strangers that it's still just as shocking today as it must have been in 1972. A fledgling New Line Cinema found an audience for PINK FLAMINGOS in the midnight movie houses that were running EL TOPO, ERASERHEAD, and ROCKY HORROR PICTURE SHOW, cementing its legacy as a cult classic.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Dragon Lives Again
show.headline: Not even death can stop Bruce Lee!

posterImages.altText: THE DRAGON LIVES AGAIN sp poster

event.title: <show-title>The Dragon Lives Again</show-title>
event.headline: Not even death can stop Bruce Lee!
event.description: Bruce Lee is dead! Long live Bruce Lee! Not even slightly inconvenienced by the lack of an actual living Bruce Lee, opportunistic producers unleashed a tidal wave of Brucesploitation movies starring martial artists with names like Bruce Li, Bruce Le, and Bruce Leong. As the trend reached peak saturation, the gimmicks got weirder: Bruce Lee vs. Supermen, Bruce Lee vs. the Clones of Bruce Lee, Bruce Lee vs. Gay Power! None of them are as weird, however, as THE DRAGON LIVES AGAIN, which begins where Bruce's life ended. The now-dead Lee finds himself in the underworld, where after incurring the wrath of the King of the Underworld, he meets Popeye the Sailor Man at a bar. Sound weird yet? A coalition of criminals led by "The Exorcist" and including such illustrious members as James Bond, Clint Eastwood, "The Godfather," Emmannuelle, and Dracula begin plotting against the King and attempting to kill Bruce. This is zany, out-of-control genre filmmaking at its best. Expect wacky slapstick, weird sex jokes, and genuine kung fu fighting set to music stolen from other soundtracks.

eventType.title: Special Event

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Heroic Trio
show.headline: Lady-powered kung fu wizardry from beyond the universe

event.title: <show-title>The Heroic Trio</show-title>
event.headline: Michelle Yeoh, Maggie Cheung, and Anita Mui superhero bonanza!
event.description:
Celebrating its 30th anniversary in 2023, THE HEROIC TRIO deserves a damn victory lap. Playing like a greatest hits of Hong Kong action’s funnest tricks, this maximalist joyride is all gas no brakes.

Johnnie To’s Hong Kong is a gothic, brutalist playscape occupied by wires and fog. Masters of the flying guillotine co-exist with desktop computers. Tex Avery writes the laws of physics. It’s always a little windy, even indoors.

An ancient evil lurks beneath the city streets...a baby-snatching baddie for whom police and professors are no match. Enter Maggie Cheung (Thief Catcher), Michelle Yeoh (Invisible Girl), and the late Anita Mui (Wonder Woman)...conflicted vigilantes and three of the baddest to ever do it.

Stuffed to the gills with on-the-nose allusions and potent visual motifs, THE HEROIC TRIO is a practical effects extravaganza with wild fits, at least two of your kinks, and a melodic theme that will live in your head rent-free. (Hyperreal Film Club)

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Voyage of the Rock Aliens
show.headline: A Greasy sci-fi 80s new wave rock musical

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Voyage of the rock aliens jimmy and the mustangs

portraitHeroImage.altText: Voyage of the rock aliens sp portrait

event.title: <show-title>Voyage of the Rock Aliens</show-title>
event.headline: A Greasy sci-fi 80s new wave rock musical
event.description:
"Highly recommend if you love 80s doing 50s but also Devo and also chainsaw murder subplots with a sub subplot about a toxic lake creature. PLUS GOOD MUSIC and a Jackson sibling (??). Everything you could ever want." - Alex T, Letterboxd

Devolution is real! This movie offers evidence that if you take the basic boy meets girl 50s sockhop and diners worshiping rock musical DNA of GREASE and put it through the Brundle transporter with Devo, the Rocky Horror Picture Show, a cheap Italian Star Wars knock-off, and a painfully unfunny Texas Chainsaw Massacre parody, you will end up with a devolved monster of a movie. Thankfully at Weird Wednesday we celebrate imperfection and appreciate mutants of all shapes and sizes. VOYAGE OF THE ROCK ALIENS is definitely an 80s rock musical, so come prepared to either suffer through or bop to Stray Cats rockabilly and dollar store Devo numbers, all are welcome. I think we can all agree it's kind of funny when androids have an orgasmic explosion (like, literally exploding) after flirting with a pretty girl though, right? In its own way, this is one of the strangest movies to escape from someone's brain and make it all the way to the silver screen. Warning: The entire first section of the movie is a Pia Zadora/Jermaine Jackson music video that has no bearing on anything that follows.

show.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
show.headline: Edgar Wright's hyper-kinetic adaptation of the cult comic

event.title: <show-title>Scott Pilgrim vs. the World</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Fourth wall-crushing epicness
event.description:
WE ARE ALAMO DRAFTHOUSE AND WE ARE HERE TO SHOW YOU AWESOME MOVIES AND HAVE FUN AND STUFF!

That’s where our SCOTT PILGRIM VS. THE WORLD Movie Party comes in. It’s a film of pure joy. An epic love letter to geek culture straight from the hearts of Edgar Wright and Bryan Lee O'Malley.

We love SCOTT PILGRIM. We love you. So in this spirit of love, we’ve brought back this epic of epicness in an epic way: with fourth wall-crushing props like a Scott Pilgrim Inflatable Bass Guitar to channel your inner Scott (or Young Neil) as you jam along to the electrifying soundtrack, a Level Up Sponge for cleaning up after making some scrummy garlic bread, and a custom double-sided "Pixelated" pressed Zinc Coin that you don’t even need to smash any evil exes to get – all included in your ticket.

It's the SCOTT PILGRIM VS. THE WORLD Movie Party and it will punch the highlights right out of your hair. Just remember, the password is “whatever”.

show.title: Jaws (1975)
show.headline: Steven Spielberg's terrifying creature feature

event.title: <show-title>Jaws (1975)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: A bigger boatload of bite-y fun
event.description:
“This shark, swallow you whole.”

Duh, nuh….duh, nuh… nothing quite says "ah, summer" like watching an elusive giant shark terrorize Amity Island on the big screen. It’s the movie that perfected the summer blockbuster and launched a million toothy (and goofy) knock-offs, but none of them can compete with the bite of Spielberg’s 1975 original. This bona fide American classic has everything you could want from a movie: kids in peril, drunken sea shanties, and Richard Dreyfuss in a cage.

As if that wasn’t enough, this is a Movie Party, so you can live the shark-hunting adventure along with your pals Brody, Hooper, and Quint – minus the salty sea air and actual mortal peril. Featuring interactive props and surprises, it’s the most fourth-wall-busting fun you can have on dry land.

show.title: Tales From The Crypt: Demon Knight
show.headline: Neon, slime, and hordes of hell-demons

event.title: <show-title>Tales From The Crypt: Demon Knight</show-title>
event.headline: Neon, slime, and hordes of hell-demons
event.description: Welcome the most joyful, outrageous, and gloopiest terrorblast of the 1990s. A full-length version of the legendary TALES FROM THE CRYPT television show on steroids, DEMON KNIGHT follows mysterious drifter Brayker (William Sadler) and spitfire Jeryline (Jada Pinkett-Smith) as they hold off an army of beasties under the command of The Collector (Billy Zane). Directed by the mighty Ernest Dickerson (cinematographer on Spike Lee’s DO THE RIGHT THING) and overflowing with phenomenal creature effects, this is a living comic book that demands to be experienced on the big screen.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, kids menus, and a free prize for kids 12 and under. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Brunch
sessionAttributes.description: Both our regular and Brunch menus are available at this screening. Arrive hungry.

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.

formats.description: All the digitalness of the Digital 2D format, but with an extra dimension!

formats.title: 35mm
formats.headline: Film print projected using film projectors.
formats.description: The industry standard for theatrical film releases prior to digital cinema. Film print projected using film projectors.

agePolicies.name: !!DO NOT USE!! All Ages
agePolicies.description: All ages will be allowed at all screenings of this show.

agePolicies.name: Rated G
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
